newsitem.title: ITALY: Colombian kidnappers release Italian engineer.
newsitem.headline: Colombian kidnappers release Italian engineer.

text.p: An Italian engineer kidnapped while working on an oil pipeline project in Colombia was released on Wednesday after five months in captivity, his employer said.
Italian oil and gas exploration company Saipem said an anonymous phone caller to the Italian embassy in Bogota on Wednesday reported that Lino Chioccioli, 49, had been freed.
Saipem said a company helicopter was dispatched to the airport at Remedios, north of the capital, and he was returned to Bogota. It did not release any details on his condition.
Chioccioli was kidnapped last August after he landed by helicopter at a construction site close to the Caribbean coast.
Saipem thanked Italy's foreign ministry and religious and humanitarian groups which helped in efforts to secure Chioccioli's release.
His daughter, Deborah, interviewed by the Italian news agency ANSA at her home in Arezzo, central Italy, said she did not want to discuss negotiations which resulted in his release.
"We are happy but we don't want to say anything else. It's logical that there were negotiations...Maybe we will recount them in a few days," she was quoted as saying.
